intro: Xylothamia johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's xylothamia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in shrubland or along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
